# Drone News 48h Brief — October 11, 2025

_Window: last 48 hours; 103 incidents._

## Summary
In the past 48 hours, there has been significant drone activity in Europe, particularly surrounding ongoing tensions in Belgium and Ukraine. Multiple incidents of drone crashes related to military operations, particularly involving Russian fighter jets attempting to disrupt drone attacks, have been reported in Ukraine. Concurrently, Belgian authorities have thwarted several drone-related terror plots aimed at public figures, leading to multiple arrests. Notably, a drone was intercepted targeting the Belgian Prime Minister, showcasing rising concerns over drone misuse for political ends. Additionally, law enforcement in the U.S. has arrested individuals involved in drone contraband smuggling while emphasizing new drone regulations to enhance security. Overall, a concerning trend emerges as drone technology increasingly intersects with criminal and military activities.

**By category:** airport: 11 • arrest: 20 • crash: 13 • other: 39 • smuggling: 10 • terrorism: 10
**Top queries:** drone terrorism (21), drone incident (16), drone illegal (15), drone arrest (14), drone crash (13)
